alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued December 22 at 4:17PM PST until December 23 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT FOR THE HONEY LAKE AND SIERRA VALLEYS... * WHAT...Visibility below 1/2 mile in fog and freezing fog across the Honey Lake and Sierra valleys. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight PST tonight. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Web cameras and observations continue to indicate dense fog and freezing fog along Highway 395 from Susanville to the Nevada state line, including near Janesville and Doyle. Freezing fog may impact Highway 70 through Sierra Valley as well. While a cold front is expected to move through the region later tonight, it is uncertain whether it will be strong enough to push the fog out and the advisory may need to be extended through the morning.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
